snippet: The public radio organization’s board approved the buyout plan while also naming an interim chief executive, Paul G. Haaga Jr.
abstract: NPR says it will try to reduce its staff by about 10 percent through voluntary buyouts; move is part of effort by public radio organization to balance its budget.
lead_paragraph: The public radio organization’s board approved the buyout plan while also naming an interim chief executive, Paul G. Haaga Jr.

headline.main: NPR Plans Buyouts  to Cut Staff 10%
headline.print_headline: NPR Plans Voluntary Buyouts to Cut Staff by 10%
